segments.text: I look at the scene with a sense of disbelief, wondering how the woman can miss the obvious danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is streaming down the cabinet doors, yet she remains fixated on that plate in her hands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a beautiful day outside, but inside this kitchen, chaos is brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies like it’s the most normal thing in the world, balanced on an unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I fear for the moment when reality catches up with them; a slip, a fall—and all this joy will turn to chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is there, hopeful and innocent, but I can’t help but cringe at how reckless they are.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Don't they realize this is not just a game? Someone could get hurt badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I also feel this spark of happiness seeing their excitement for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's strange how these moments can fill you with joy while simultaneously instilling fear.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: In this kitchen, it feels like everything is at stake, and I wish someone would just look up.
segments.speaker: PAR
